Authors:
Digvijayini Bundhun, Dhanushka Nadeeshan Wanasinghe,
Sajeewa Maharachchikumbura
Title:
Yuxiensis granularis gen. et sp. nov., a novel
quellkörper-bearing taxon, added to Scortechiniaceae and inclusion of
Parasympodiellaceae in Coronophorales based on phylogenetic
evidence
Keywords:
2 new taxa, 1 new combination, Hypocreomycetidae,
phylogeny, Sordariomycetes, systematics
Abstract:
An unknown saprobic taxon collected from Yunnan (China) is
revealed as a new genus in Scortechiniaceae (Coronophorales). The novel
taxon, Yuxiensis, is distinctly characterised by immersed to erumpent,
semi-globose ascomata which are not surrounded by any tomentum or
conspicuous subiculum, a subcylindrical quellkörper in the centrum,
clavate asci with long pedicels and allantoid hyaline ascospores with
granular contents. Maximum likelihood and Bayesian posterior probability
analyses based on LSU, ITS, tef1 and rpb2 sequence data depict a close
relationship of the new genus to Pseudocatenomycopsis, hence, confirming
its placement in Scortechiniaceae. Parasympodiellaceae, thus far
belonging to Parasympodiellales, is shifted to Coronophorales based on
phylogenetic evidence. Additionally, the incertae sedis monotypic genus
Arthrocristula, is treated as a synonym of Parasympodiella, with
Arthrocristula hyphenata recombined as Parasympodiella hyphenata
comb.nov., as the ex-type strain of Arthrocristula hyphenata clusters
inside the Parasympodiellaceae clade along with other Parasympodiella
taxa.
